posts.author: RogueReroll
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to Prestidigitation make it much more balanced compared to before.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how Prestidigitation works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use Prestidigitation to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

In my campaign, we had a situation with Prestidigitation that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: InitiativeTracker
posts.content:
I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for Prestidigitation are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

The way I understand the rules for Prestidigitation, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use Prestidigitation to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!
